fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25993].
  {panel}

It would be useful to exclude the current page from the list of pages shown by the Content by Label macro.

Can we have a parameter that allows this option?

*Use case:*

We use Content by Label to show a list of related topics on a page. The page that contains the macro therefore usually has the same label as the other related pages. This results in the page showing a list of related topics that includes itself.

If we could exclude the current page, this would prevent circular references.
fields.summary: Add option to exclude current page from list shown by Content by Label macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25913].
  {panel}

When selecting "Export to Word" on a Confluence Page, the resulting .doc-file offered for download is best described as a practical joke.

It's contents are basically an E-Mail with HTML-content, whereby the HTML-Tags are (of course) written out, like everything else. This would make slightly more sense if it were a plain-text file, as one might be able to import the contents into a Mail-Client, but in a Word-File, this behaviour makes no sense to me.

How to reproduce:
1) Go to any Page in Confluence, for example https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Exporting+Confluence+Pages+and+Spaces+to+PDF
2) Click on "Tools" in the top-right corner
3) In that menu, select "Export to Word"
4) Open the resulting download in Word
fields.summary: Make the output from export to word reflect the design and layout of the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25907].
  {panel}

*Situation:*
A user is watching a page. Everytime someone mention him in that page, he receives two e-mails. One saying that the page was changed or commented, and other saying that he was mentioned. For users who use this features, it can be annoying. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
*If a user is already watching a page*
1) Create a page as user A
2) User B watches this page (either by commenting or explictly adding themselves as a watcher)
3) User A adds a comment to the page mentioning (@userB) User B.

*If the user is already watching a page and a task is assigned to them*
1) Create a page as user A
2) User B watches the page
3) User A assigns a task to User B. User B now gets two emails (Assigned task, and a page mention)

*Expected Result:*
User B receives one e-mail (take a pick of choosing the comment or the mention)

*Actual Result:*
User B receives two e-mails (one for the mention, one for the comment)
fields.summary: Prevent double notifications when I'm mentioned in a page I'm already watching

Diagnosis:
In OSX ctrl-e will move the cursor to the end of the current line. This works in things like the search box, the post title box, and even the textbox that I'm typing in now, as I file this ticket, but not the box where you type in the post body in Confluence.

In OSX, create a new post, type some text, hit ctrl-a: cursor jumps to beginning of line. Then hit ctrl-e.

Actual: cursor doesn't move

It is not possible to have one page associated in multiple locations in the page hierarchy. Often a page fits in more than one place in a wiki structure.
In other Wikis this is quite a normal feature.

Example:
We have general documentation and team internal documentation. Some team docs are of general interest. Then I would like to add this page to the general documentation, keeping the original page in the team docs. 
At the moment I worked it around via a second page which uses the "Include Page" macro. But then only the original page can be edited.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25835].
  {panel}

Page load times tend to increase exponentially when multiple JIRA issues macros are used, even for simple queries. 

As a workaround you can limit the amount of issues returned or use dynamic render mode which appears to use caching better, but it could be improved for both modes.

To reproduce:

# Create a page
# Add a JIRA issues macro with this XML view: https://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+CONF+AND+issuetype+in+%28Bug%2C+%22New+Feature%22%2C+Improvement%29+AND+fixVersion+%3D+%224.2.2%22+AND+status+in+%28Resolved%2C+Closed%29+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC%2C+key+DESC&tempMax=200
# Save the page and monitor page load time
# Edit the page and add copy/paste the JIRA issues macro to create multiples
# Save the page and monitor page load time

Page will load times will increase exponentially, even if the same query is being returned by each macro.
fields.summary: Improve performance/caching of multiple JIRA Issues macros
Request access to spaces (see all space names)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25828].
  {panel}

After much digging around the Confluence source I have not found a way to achieve this.

It would be great to have a universal prefix to any static file URL generated by confluence (for such things as attachments, CSS includes, JS includes, img tags and so on) so that an administrator could configure those resources to load from one or more additional hostnames.

This would enable administrators to load static resources from numerous hostnames to increase the parallel download of resources across hostnames and (as in my case) enable them to use a Content Delivery Network to serve up static files from confluence.

While this is not as relevant for Wiki's being used internally to an organisation for ones that are used across the Internet (and more specifically across extended geographical locations) the use of a CDN would greatly reduce the load on the Confluence server and speed up delivery of the page to the client.
Cheers
Stuart
fields.summary: Enable universal prefix to file URLs

It seems that JIRA users who do not have permission to access Confluence can still see the status updates of Confluence users.  

Steps to replicate (per-requisite: Set up JIRA and Confluence application link):
# Set up Confluence to use JIRA user base
# Create a user that does not have access to Confluence.  In other words, users can only access JIRA.  For example JIRAuser
# A user in Confluence [updates his/her status|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF34/Viewing+Status+Updates]
# Login to JIRA as a user who does not have permission to Confluence.  This user is still able to see the status updates of Confluence Users from JIRA Activity Stream.
fields.summary: Users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream

The older pages of the documentation helpfully describe the parameters: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=256869846

But this is no longer visible on the current page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Chart+Macro

This is really key information to present, please include in the existing documentation going forward.

fields.summary: LazyInitializationException when trying to save a page
Like Gadget breaks unless used within the Page Include macro
Add "@network" parameter to "Recently Updated" macro
Please list watchers in alphabetical order
Improve copy-paste experience between HipChat and Confluence for a conversation
Make the notify watchers functionality of page edits more discreet
Display a warning when the base url is set to localhost
The hovering hints are REALLY *REALLY* irritating
Remove edit button on user settings page
Ability to choose what group invited users are allocated into
Allow space admins to invite users
Improve the SSL/HTTPS documentation to include PCKS#12
Conflluence editor supports http link which contains asterisk

Bundle US English language pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25726].
  {panel}

*Summary of the Request*

When third party plugin installed in Confluence, administrator don't have the power to configure which plugins are listed when Confluence user click on the "Insert" button.

This resulted to a long ugly list of third party plugins filled up the window and since there are no scroll bar, users won't be able to choose "Other Macros" button.

*Propose Improvement*

It would be great if Confluence administrator have the ability to chose which plugins Confluence editor listed on the main menu of the "Insert" button. By adding an extra option of "Listed" on the plugin option in "Universal Plugin Manager", Confluence administrator will have the ability to ensure which plugin listed and which are not
fields.summary: Ability to configure which plugins listed in the "Insert" button
cannot signup to confluence
